intro: Prasium majus var. liparitanum, commonly known as the Liparitanum Prasium, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its striking, often bi-colored leaves that display a combination of green and silver hues. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and unique botanical features, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
